image.altText: Side-by-side photos of Bianca Jones and Holly Bowles, two Melbourne teens who have been hospitalised in Thailand

props.synopsis: Holly Bowles's parents are by her side in a Thai hospital as the Melbourne woman fights for life after drinking tainted alcohol.

title.children: Families in bedside vigils for Melbourne 19yos hospitalised after apparent methanol poisoning in Laos

image.altText: An ambulance in Melbourne's CBD.

props.synopsis: Police are piecing together the circumstances surrounding an accident on Victoria's Western Highway between a truck and a car that left one person dead and others injured.

title.children: One dead, two injured after accident on major Victorian highway

image.altText: Three little penguins bunched together on sand

props.synopsis: More than 21,000 people have signed a petition to abolish the permits, and now two MPs from different parts of the political spectrum are trying to get them banned too.

title.children: Teal and Liberal MP unite against seismic testing permits that could threaten little penguin colonies

image.altText: An aerial image of bushland with the faces of Greg Lynn, Carol Clay and Russell Hill on top.

props.synopsis: The former Jetstar pilot has formally lodged an appeal to try to overturn the jury's verdict and judge's sentence over the death of Victorian camper Carol Clay.

title.children: Greg Lynn lodges appeal against his murder conviction and sentence over Carol Clay's death

image.altText: Woman in wheelchair at graduation ceremony

props.synopsis: Jade McAlear sustained multiple fractures and was in a coma in Royal Melbourne Hospital for four months. She is now living with an acquired brain injury (ABI).

title.children: Jade lives with acquired brain injury and wants people to stop treating her like a child

image.altText: A blue sleeve with a Victoria Police badge sewn into it, including the motto "Uphold the Right".

props.synopsis: A former Victoria Police officer is jailed for three years after faking DNA and handwriting test results while working in the drug squad.

title.children: Corrupt Victorian police officer jailed after faking DNA results in drug squad investigation

image.altText: Perry Kouroumblis

props.synopsis: The Italian government has signed off on Australia's request to extradite Perry Kouroumblis, who was arrested in September in relation to the 1977 Easey Street murders.

title.children: Prime suspect in notorious Melbourne double murder set to be extradited to Australia from Italy

image.altText: Min Woo Lee smiling as a gallery cheers on the golf course

props.synopsis: Australia's golf majors are upon us and such is the enormity of the boom across the sport since COVID, there is no more yearning for the big overseas star that the Aussie tour felt it needed for so long.

title.children: Big names and compelling storylines give this year's Aussie golf majors plenty of intrigue

image.altText: woman looking through fence

props.synopsis: This global religious sect has restrictions around television, eating with others and attending university. Its members also run schools and a charity that have received millions of dollars in funding from taxpayers.

title.children: Former Brethren members speak out about life in a religious sect

image.altText: Close-up shot of Scales of Justice statue in Brisbane CBD on August 1, 2018.

props.synopsis: Child protection workers in Victoria are sounding the alarm about a plan to scrap hearings known as conciliation conferences, which they say will disadvantage vulnerable members of the community and Aboriginal families.

title.children: Fears vulnerable children could be disadvantaged under plans to cut conciliation conferences in Victoria

image.altText: A family of four on a motorcycle waits at a traffic light surrounded by smog

props.synopsis: Measures to curb pollution such as installing more pollution monitors and pushing for a switch to cleaner fuels are yet to yield significant results.

title.children: 'It's an apocalypse': Smog in India, Pakistan up to 60 times safe level spurs calls for action

image.altText: A collection of seized tobacco and cigarettes

props.synopsis: There are hopes new Victorian legislation and police powers will help shift the onus away from local government when it comes to stamping out the illegal tobacco trade.

title.children: State crackdown in tobacco wars welcomed by former mayor of council that spent $25K prosecuting illegal sellers

image.altText: A drone shot showing bleached coral.

props.synopsis: Large sections of the Great Barrier Reef appear to have been smashed by climate change and cyclones this year, with one reef near Lizard Island losing nearly three quarters of its coral cover since the beginning of the year.

title.children: 'Our worst fears': Scientists warn of damage to Great Barrier Reef

image.altText: an elderly woman looking at the camera

props.synopsis: The crown prosecution in a manslaughter trial says no-one was at risk of injury from a great-grandmother who died after being tasered by a police officer, but the defence says it was the accused's "job to obtain a resolution".

title.children: Jury hears police officer who tasered a 95yo woman was 'fed up, impatient, not prepared to wait any longer'

image.altText: A woman stands in a garden, looking into camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: The scandal threatening to engulf Australia's superannuation industry has spread to another major operator, Australian Ethical, which has apologised for taking almost a year to process a widow's application to access her dead husband's retirement savings.

title.children: Superannuation crisis spreads to sustainable-branded fund Australian Ethical

image.altText: Elderly woman sits on her bed longingly holding an old black and white photo of her younger self next to her late husband.

props.synopsis: When Shirley met the love of her life at age 19, Australian society didn't allow her and her soulmate to be together.

title.children: Chance meeting sparks love story that endured White Australia heartache

image.altText: A young woman with brown hair wearing a white dress stands in front of a bright cafe looking at the camera

props.synopsis: More than 6 million people have been forced to leave Ukraine since Russia launched its illegal invasion in 2022, but some people have built new lives elsewhere while remaining determined to one day rebuild their homeland.

title.children: Russia's invasion of Ukraine forced 6 million refugees to seek a new life elsewhere

image.altText: Two men in suits shake hands in front of flags of Australia and China.

props.synopsis: The Chinese president has spoken of the "twists and turns" in recent relations with Australia during talks with Anthony Albanese on the sidelines of the G20 summit.

title.children: Xi Jinping urges Anthony Albanese to manage China relations with 'great care' in G20 meeting

image.altText: Chris Murphy exists a police station.

props.synopsis: The lawyer for veteran broadcaster Alan Jones has criticised a senior police officer and confirmed his client will defend himself against historical indecent assault and sexual touching charges.

title.children: Alan Jones's lawyer slams senior police officer's comment as 'contemptible' and vows to fight charges

image.altText: Sam Kerr of the Matildas signs the shirt of her partner Kristie Mewis after a match

props.synopsis: Matildas captain Sam Kerr target of homophobic abuse after revealing she is having a baby with her fiancee Kristie Mewis.

title.children: Sam Kerr subjected to homophobic abuse after announcing first child with partner Kristie Mewis

image.altText: A woman shears a sheep as two men watch.

props.synopsis: The 37-year-old mother-of-four managed a running average of 72.3 seconds per lamb to secure a place in the shearing record books.

title.children: Yass woman shears 395 merino lambs in 8 hours, setting world record

image.altText: The eye of a crocodile in green water

props.synopsis: The man was attacked while spearfishing on Western Australia's remote Dampier Peninsula and hit the animal in order to get away, according to senior rangers.

title.children: Kimberley man punched crocodile in nose to escape attack, ranger says

image.altText: Woolworths

props.synopsis: Woolworths faced scrutiny at the ACCC's inquiry regarding its treatment of fruit and vegetable suppliers. Meanwhile, the ASX reached another intra-day record high. Catch up on the day's events and insights from ABC News' markets blog.

title.children: Woolworths refuses to answer ACCC's questions on bargaining power, Tesla rallies, ASX hits another intra-day record high — as it happened

image.altText: A person in camouflage gear stands next to a large truck with piles of white bags on it.

props.synopsis: The convoy was travelling through southern Gaza on Saturday when the UN's Palestinian aid agency UNRWA says it was set upon by armed gunmen.

title.children: UN says more than 100 aid trucks in Gaza have been lost to looting

image.altText: An older woman looking angrey near a riverbed

props.synopsis: Sela Vosikata has lived in her Fijian village her whole life — and she has a simple message for the world's leaders: come here and see it for yourself.

title.children: Fijian villagers facing relocation due to climate change have message for Donald Trump

image.altText: A man in a dark blue shirt stands against a dark red backdrop. His head is cocked, and he's almost smiling.

props.synopsis: Nick Ward takes time out during his national tour with Troye Sivan to talk to to Chit Chat about his debut album, favourite films and more.

title.children: How Troye Sivan taught his tour support Nick Ward that pop 'is not a dirty word'

image.altText: Deborah Cheetham Fraillon pictured wearing purple glasses and a leather jacket. She's smiling, looking straight to the camera.

props.synopsis: From being inspired by seeing Dame Joan Sutherland perform to carving her own path, Deborah Cheetham Fraillon AO reflects on her achievements and her drive to help others.

title.children: Music helped Deborah Cheetham Fraillon connect with her First Nations family even though they were separated for so long

image.altText: Cassandra Barratt and Archie 1

props.synopsis: The gender pay gap — the difference in average pay between Australian men and women — is 11.5 per cent, which is the equivalent of working from November 19 until the end of they year without being paid for it.

title.children: Gender pay gap means 'today is the day that women effectively start working for free'

image.altText: A manufacturing staff member wearing orange hi-viz clothing kneeling alongside yellow machinery and handling black cabling

props.synopsis: The federal government has announced the first recipient of taxpayer investment under the National Reconstruction Fund, with "a dozen" more announcements promised before the election.

title.children: Queensland mining equipment firm gets $40 million in taxpayer funds in first National Reconstruction Fund announcement

image.altText: Teenage students solve maths problems in workbooks.

props.synopsis: Spelling mistakes and incorrect questions have been identified in several year 11 and 12 exams in Tasmania. One concerned parent says it left her son "rattled".

title.children: Teacher says end-of-year exam was 'borderline disgraceful' after students find incorrect questions

image.altText: Pamela Rabe, a middle-aged-woman, wearing glasses, her greying hair pulled back, narrows her eyes, a cigarette in her fingers.

props.synopsis: Pamela Rabe has been a star of Australian stage and screen for more than 40 years. Now, she takes on a new challenge: playing the matriarch in August: Osage County.

title.children: Pamela Rabe was a great TV villain in Wentworth, now she's taking on one of theatre's 'monsters'

image.altText: British journalist and author Jon Ronson speaking on the ABC's Q+A program

props.synopsis: Best-selling author Jon Ronson has studied the human psyche and Donald Trump's MAGA movement. He told Q+A why cultural signals are increasing the disaffection of young men from politics.

title.children: 'It's a strange time to be a man': Jon Ronson on Donald Trump and the growing disaffection of young men

image.altText: One person kicking the head of an opponent who is bending over the net.

props.synopsis: A pickleball tournament in Mexico has gone viral after a vicious kick to the head soured the end of a championship game.

title.children: 'Disgusting and completely unacceptable': Horrific head kick after pickleball tournament loss goes viral

image.altText: Bee Gees tribute band Best of the Bee Gees announced Colin Petersen's passing with "heavy hearts".

props.synopsis: His death was announced by tribute band The Best of the Bee Gees, who he toured with extensively over the past five years.

title.children: Original Bee Gees drummer Colin 'Smiley' Petersen dies at 78
